###Question 6###
```{r}
library(ggplot2)
data("cars")
ggplot(cars, aes(x=speed, y=dist)) + 
  geom_point(color='Black', size = 1) + 
  geom_smooth(method=lm, color='Blue') + labs(title= 'Reaction time for the driver to start breaking ', x= 'Speed ( in units mph)', y= 'Breaking distance (in units of feet) ')
```

###Question 7###

```{r}
library(ggplot2)


data <- cars
reg_data <- lm(dist ~ speed + I(speed^2), data=data)
reg_data
reg_data$coefficients[3]
data$new_speed <- data$speed * (5280/3600)###converting speed miles per housr to feet per second.###


reg_data <- lm(dist ~ 0 + new_speed + I(new_speed^2), data=data)
summary(reg_data) # Adding the 0 term tells the lm() to fit the line through the origin

ggplot(data, aes(x = new_speed, y = dist)) + 
 geom_point(color='Black', size = 1) + 
 geom_smooth(method = "lm", formula = "y ~ 0 + x + I(x^2)",  color="red") + labs(title= 'Reaction time for the driver to start breaking ', y = 'Stopping Distance of a Car in Feet', x = "The Speed of a Car in Feet per second")

```
